intro: Carpotroche angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf carpotroche, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central corolla. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
